keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as LADA, which he manages with the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System.
He created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate the public about diabetes with humor, developed accidentally through social media content.
Bass shares that white rice and white bread significantly spike his blood sugar, even with small amounts, making them off-limits for him.
He attributes his improved diabetes management to modern monitoring technology and support from the diabetic community.
Stress from his busy career and parenting four-year-old twins impacts his blood sugar levels.
There is no current plan for an *NSYNC reunion tour, and Lance Bass dismisses recent claims about such a reunion as misinformation.
His personal experience with diabetes, especially growing up with a diabetic uncle, has shaped his awareness and advocacy for better diabetes education and management.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, former member of *NSYNC, shares his personal journey with type 1.5 diabetes (LADA), emphasizing how modern technology like the Dexcom G7 monitoring system and supportive diabetic communities have improved his daily management. He created the online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate the public with humor, highlighting how certain foods like white rice and white bread can cause dangerous blood sugar spikes. While fans hope for a potential *NSYNC reunion, Bass confirms there is no current plan and dismisses recent speculation as misinformation. His experience underscores the importance of awareness, personalization in diet, and mental health in managing chronic illness, especially in high-stress, public-facing roles.
title: Lance Bass has more to say about living with diabetes than he does about an *NSYNC reunion
